meanings.sent1: The pong from the garbage can was unbearable.
meanings.sent2: I wrinkled my nose at the pong coming from the old socks.
meanings.sent3: The pong in the room was so bad, we had to open all the windows.
meanings.sent4: The pong of rotten eggs filled the kitchen, making me gag.
meanings.sent5: The pong of the skunk spray lingered in the air for hours.

meanings.sent1: The pong of the church bells echoed through the town.
meanings.sent2: The pong of the gong signaled the start of the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The pong of the drum reverberated in the concert hall.
meanings.sent4: The pong of the thunder shook the windows.
meanings.sent5: The pong of the fireworks filled the night sky with color.

meanings.definition: To emit a strong, unpleasant smell.
meanings.sent1: The garbage can ponged after sitting in the sun all day.
meanings.sent2: The socks ponged so badly, I had to wash them twice.
meanings.sent3: The room ponged with the smell of dirty laundry.
meanings.sent4: The kitchen ponged with the stench of spoiled milk.
meanings.sent5: The bathroom ponged of mildew and mold.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, resonant sound.
meanings.sent1: The church bells ponged loudly on Sunday mornings.
meanings.sent2: The gong ponged as the martial arts class began.
meanings.sent3: The drum ponged rhythmically in the music studio.
meanings.sent4: The thunder ponged ominously in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks ponged brightly in the night sky.
